othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: General troubleshooting reference: alarm messages, diagnostic tables and recommended actions for common UPS faults.

section.title: Alarm messages
section.p: The following table lists all pop-up messages that can appear on the display:

row.entry: Number
Alarm message
Pop-up message
Description
Corrective action
System configuration not OK. Hardware inoperable or wrong configuration file loaded.
Check the configuration file

entry.uicontrol: Battery temperature has exceeded upper limit

row.entry: The battery temperature is above the configured warning level.
Check the air inlet
Check the ambient temperature
Check the charge current
Check the health of the battery
The UPS output voltage (RMS) is above the configured voltage level.

entry.p: Check the load

row.entry: The UPS output is overloaded (>105%).
Reduce the load
The battery voltage is above the configured high battery voltage warning level. This warning is suppressed in battery operation.

entry.p: Check if the setting High battery warning level is set correctly. Check the asymmetry of the load (positive and negative part).

entry.uicontrol: Inverter shutdown due to low Battery

row.entry: The battery voltage is below the configured low battery voltage shutdown level.
Charge the battery
The UPS measures a battery earth fault.
Check the battery wiring
The advanced battery monitoring test has detected a weak battery.
Charge the battery
Maintain the battery
The advanced battery monitoring test has detected an inoperable battery.
Maintain the battery
The battery switch Q201 / Q202 is open.
The ABUS wiring is disconnected or the ABUS termination is incorrect.

entry.uicontrol: No Master present in the parallel system

row.entry: No master is present in the redundant system.

entry.p: (number of global master = 0) Check the PBUS wiring

row.entry: At least one UPS is isolated or turned off. In this case the redundancy operation is not assured.

entry.p: Connect the corresponding UPS resp. turn UPS on

entry.uicontrol: Parallel bus communication on cable 1 inoperable

row.entry: The internal or external PBUS1 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS1 termination is incorrect.

entry.p: Check the PBUS wiring

entry.uicontrol: Parallel bus communication on cable 2 inoperable

row.entry: The internal or external PBUS2 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS2 termination is incorrect.

entry.p: Check the PBUS wiring

row.entry: The digital input "emergency power off (EPO)" is activated (contact open) or the EPO wiring is disconnected.

entry.p: If the EPO is activated, normal function. If the EPO is not activated, check the EPO wiring.

row.entry: An internal inoperable state was detected.

entry.p: Check the event log and solve the problem. Replace the power module.

row.entry: The communication to the SBS is not working or DC is detected during requested static bypass operation.

entry.p: Check the wiring to the SBS module

row.entry: The UPS measures a temperature above the threshold level in one of the power modules or in one of the power transformers.
Check the air inlet and the air filters
Check the ambient temperature
Check the output load
One of the transformer-, SBS- or power module fans is inoperable.
Check the correct functionality of the fans
The PFC rectifier or the charger is inoperable.
The inverter is inoperable.
HMI_1
Communication via ABUS does not work.

Check the ABUS wiring
and termination
HMI_2
The SELV4 supply of the HMI is missing.
Check the ABUS wiring
HMI_3

entry.uicontrol: No more space for configurations in HMI FLASH memory

row.entry: The HMI Flash memory does not offer enough free space to save the configuration change.
Unplug and reconnect HMI supply
HMI_4
The external SRAM on the HMI was detected to be inoperable.

entry.p: Replace the display.

row.entry: HMI_5
The HMI firmware detected an invalid code memory CRC.

entry.p: Most probably, the hardware is defective and has to be replaced

section.title: Log Event Descriptions
section.p: The following table lists all events that can appear on the display log and that can be assigned to LEDs and relays:

row.entry: Number
Log text for alarm
Log text when alarm is resolved
Alarm text
Description
Corrective action
The system is in standby.
The system is in battery operation.
The system is in normal operation.
The system is in requested static bypass operation due to a user request.
The system is in temporary static bypass operation due to a problem in the system.
Check the event log for the reason, why the system has switched to static bypass operation
The battery charger has been set to OFF state. The batteries are not charged in this state.
The battery charger has been set to Float charge state. The batteries are charged with the configured float charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to Boost charge mode. The batteries are charged with the configured boost charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to Initial charge mode. The batteries are charged with the configured initial charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to Cyclic charge mode. The batteries are charged with the configured cyclic charge voltage.
The digital input to block boost resp. initial charge is activated.
The rectifier part of the power module is not working.

entry.p: Check the shut-down cause by means of the Service port. Replace the power module.

row.entry: The charger part of the power module is not working.

entry.p: Check the shutdown cause by means of the service port. Replace the power module.

row.entry: The inverter part of the power module is not working.

entry.p: Check the shutdown cause by means of the service port. Replace the power module.

row.entry: The UPS is unable to synchronize to the bypass source.

Check the bypass source quality (voltage, frequency)
The limits of the configured bypass voltage tolerance should be bigger than the limits of the configured output voltage tolerance.
The system is in static bypass operation. The bypass supplies the load (temporary or requested static bypass operation).

The static bypass switch is not energized, the communication wiring from the UPS controller to the static bypass switch controller is disconnected or the static bypass switch controller is inoperable.
Check if the static bypass switch controller board is energized
Check the communication wiring between main controller and the static bypass switch controller
Check the function of the static bypass switch controller board
The SBS is no longer controlled by the UPS controller and is locked in the fire state.
Check the communication wiring
Check the function of the UPS controller
This state can only be left when the SBS controller board is reset. This should be done by switching the manual bypass switch to 'Bypass'
DC content detected in requested static bypass operation.

entry.p: Replace the SBS module (probably SCR fault)

row.entry: The manual bypass switch is in position BYPASS.
The manual bypass switch is in position AUTO.
The power module temperature is above 90 °C.
Check the air inlet of the UPS
Check the fan module
Check the ambient temperature
Reduce the load
The power module temperature is above 100 °C (delay 60 seconds). The inverter is shut down immediately.
Check the air inlet of the UPS
Check the fan module
Check the ambient temperature
Reduce the load
The rectifier mains transformer temperature is above the configured threshold level. After 10 minutes, the rectifier is shut down and the system changes to battery operation.
Check the air inlet of the UPS
Check the fan module
Check the ambient temperature
Reduce the battery charging current
Reduce the load

The output transformer temperature is above the configured threshold level. After 10 minutes, the system tries to change to static bypass operation within the next 2 minutes. If the change to static bypass operation is not possible due to bad bypass quality the inverter is shut down after these 2 minutes.
Check the air inlet of the UPS
Check the fan module
Check the ambient temperature
Reduce the load
The bypass transformer temperature is above the threshold level.
Check the air inlet of the UPS
Check the fan module
Check the ambient temperature
Reduce the load
The battery temperature is above the configured warning level.
Check the air inlet
Check the ambient temperature
Check the charge current
Check the health of the battery
The battery temperature is above the configured shutdown level. The battery charger switches off.
Check the air inlet
Check the ambient temperature
Check the health of the battery
The sensor, connected to the external connection board, measures a temperature above the configured warning level.
The sensor, connected to the external connection board, measures a temperature above the configured warning level.
The sensor, connected to the external connection board, measures a temperature above the configured warning level.
The mains input transformer temperature sensor is not connected or shorted.
Check the wiring of the temperature sensor
The output transformer temperature sensor is not connected or shorted.
Check the wiring of the temperature sensor
The bypass transformer temperature sensor is not connected or shorted.
Check the wiring of the temperature sensor
One of the power module fans is inoperable.
Check the fans of the power modules
One of the static bypass switch fans is inoperable.
Check the static bypass switch fans
One of the transformer fans is inoperable (rectifier transformer, output transformer or bypass transformer).
Check the transformer fans
The rectifier mains voltage is out of the configured tolerance.
Check the quality of the mains input (voltage and frequency)
The rectifier mains voltage on primary side of the input transformer is out of the configured tolerance.
Check the quality of the mains input (voltage and frequency)
The rectifier mains voltage is out of tolerance.
The rectifier mains frequency is out of the configured tolerance.
A rectifier mains input phase is missing.
Check the contacts of the input switch
Check the control wiring of the input voltage measurement
Check the correct wiring of the input transformer
One phase of the rectifier mains voltage on the primary side of the input transformer is missing.
Check the contacts of the input switch
Check the control wiring of the input voltage measurement
The mains PFC rectifier is unable to synchronize to the rectifier mains input.
Check the quality of the mains input (voltage and frequency)
The rectifier mains neutral is missing.
Check the mains neutral wiring
The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance. The UPS is not able to transfer to static bypass operation.

entry.p: This error can be caused by the RMS detector.

row.entry: The bypass mains voltage on the primary side of the bypass transformer is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: Enforce the bypass mains source. Probably install a stabilizer. If allowed by application, enlarge the bypass voltage limit.

row.entry: The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance. The UPS is unable to transfer to static bypass operation.

entry.p: This error can be caused by the FAST detector (if selected).

row.entry: The bypass frequency is out of the configured tolerance. The UPS is unable to transfer to static bypass operation.

entry.p: Enforce the bypass mains source. If allowed by application, enlarge the bypass frequency limit.

row.entry: One phase of the bypass mains is missing.

entry.p: Check the wiring in the bypass section

row.entry: One phase of the bypass voltage on the primary side of the transformer is missing.

entry.p: Check the bypass. Check the bypass voltage connection to the interface.

row.entry: The UPS output voltage is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: If overloaded, reduce the load detected by the RMS detector. This can happen if the output is overloaded or shorted.

row.entry: The output voltage on the secondary side of the output transformer is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: If overloaded, reduce the load

row.entry: The UPS output voltage is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: If overloaded, reduce the load detected by the FAST detector (if activated). This can happen if the output is overloaded or shorted.

row.entry: The UPS output frequency is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: Replace the power module

row.entry: One phase of the output voltage on the secondary side of the transformer is missing.

entry.p: Check the bypass. Check the output voltage connection to the interface.

row.entry: The load is above the configured load alarm level.
Reduce the load
The inverter current limiter is active.
Reduce the load
The UPS output is overloaded (>105%).
Reduce the load
The battery voltage is above the configured high battery voltage shutdown level. The charger is shut down.

entry.p: Replace the power module

row.entry: The battery voltage is above the configured high battery voltage warning level. This warning is suppressed in battery operation.

entry.p: Check if the setting High battery warning level is set correctly. Check the asymmetry of the load (positive and negative part).

row.entry: The battery voltage is below the configured low battery voltage warning level.
Charge the battery
The battery voltage is below the configured low battery voltage shutdown level.
Charge the battery
The UPS measures a positive battery earth fault.
Check the battery wiring
The UPS measures a negative battery earth fault.
Check the battery wiring
The advanced battery monitoring test has been started.
The advanced battery monitoring test has been completed.
The advanced battery monitoring test has been aborted.
The advanced battery monitoring test has detected a weak battery.
Charge the battery
Maintain the battery
The advanced battery monitoring test has detected an inoperable battery.
Maintain the battery
The battery runtime is less than 2 minutes above the configured warning level.

entry.p: Reduce the load, or try to switch to normal or bypass operation, or to recharge the battery

row.entry: The battery runtime is below the configured battery runtime level.

entry.p: Reduce the load, or try to switch to normal or bypass operation, or to recharge the discharged battery

row.entry: The battery discharge test has been started.
The battery discharge test has been completed.
The battery discharge test has been aborted.
The rectifier mains input switch Q001 is open.
The battery switch Q201 / Q202 is open.
The bypass mains input switch Q501 is open.

entry.p: Close the bypass mains input switch Q501

row.entry: The load output switch Q611 is open.

entry.p: Close the load output switch Q611

row.entry: The bypass backfeed contactor K401 is open.

entry.p: Check the bypass mains

row.entry: The SBS input switch Q528 is open.
The ABUS wiring is disconnected or the ABUS termination is incorrect.
No master is present in the redundant system.

entry.p: (number of global master = 0) Check the PBUS wiring

row.entry: The actual load is too high to guarantee the redundant operation. If one UPS switches OFF, the remaining systems would be overloaded.

entry.p: Reduce the load. This event appears also when both systems are in standby and the system get coupled. This need to be like this because otherwise the popup appears when one system starts and this is strange as well.

row.entry: At least one UPS is isolated or turned off. In this case the redundancy operation is not assured.

entry.p: Connect the corresponding UPS resp. turn UPS on

row.entry: The internal or external PBUS1 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS1 termination is incorrect.

entry.p: Check the PBUS wiring

row.entry: The internal or external PBUS2 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS2 termination is incorrect.

entry.p: Check the PBUS wiring

row.entry: The internal or external PBUS1 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS1 termination is incorrect.

entry.p: Check the PBUS wiring and whether the PBUS termination is available

row.entry: The internal or external PBUS2 wiring (parallel bus) is disconnected or the PBUS2 termination is incorrect.

entry.p: Check the PBUS wiring and whether the PBUS termination is available

row.entry: The digital input "emergency power off (EPO)" is activated (contact open) or the EPO wiring is disconnected.

entry.p: If the EPO is activated, normal function. If the EPO is not activated, check the EPO wiring.

row.entry: An internal inoperable state was detected.

entry.p: Check the event log and solve the problem. Replace the power module.

row.entry: The system has been locked in static bypass operation after 8 unsuccessful tries to switch back to normal or battery operation.

entry.p: Check the proper function of the inverter
Reset the pendle lock over the service port

row.entry: The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the fan modules.

entry.p: Contact Reality for required service actions.

row.entry: The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the battery.

entry.p: Contact Reality for required service actions.

row.entry: The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the power modules.

entry.p: Contact Reality for required service actions.

row.entry: The life cycle monitoring recommends to replace the air filters.

entry.p: Contact Reality for required service actions.

row.entry: The life cycle monitoring recommends to do the 10 year component replacement.

entry.p: Contact Reality for required service actions.

row.entry: External connection board input 1 open / close

entry.p: The input of the external connection board is configured customer specific. Please see in the setting sheet for details.

row.entry: External connection board input 2 open / close

entry.p: The input of the external connection board is configured customer specific. Please see in the setting sheet for details.

row.entry: There is at least one pending alert in the system.

entry.p: Check the other event.

row.entry: The communication to the SBS is not working or DC is detected during requested static bypass operation.

entry.p: Check the wiring to the SBS module

row.entry: The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance, a phase is missing, there is an invalid phase rotation or the frequency is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: Check the bypass mains at the bypass input terminals.

row.entry: The output voltage or the frequency is out of configured tolerance.

entry.p: Check the output voltage quality or reduce the load.

row.entry: The mains input voltage is out of the configured tolerance, a phase is missing, there is an invalid phase rotation or the frequency is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: Check the rectifier mains source at the mains input terminals.

row.entry: The UPS measures a temperature above the threshold level in one of the power modules or in one of the power transformers.
Check the air inlet and the air filters
Check the ambient temperature
Check the output load
The battery voltage is out of the configured tolerance or the battery runtime is too short.

entry.p: Recharge or replace the battery

row.entry: One of the transformer-, SBS- or power module fans is inoperable.
Check the correct functionality of the fans
The UPS measures a battery earth fault.
Check the battery wiring
The PFC rectifier or the charger is inoperable.
The inverter is inoperable.

fig.title: Alarm LEDs on the Display Interface

row.entry: Number
LED text
Description
Corrective action
The mains input voltage is out of the configured tolerance, a phase is missing, there is an invalid phase rotation or the frequency is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: Check the rectifier mains source at the mains input terminals.

row.entry: The bypass voltage is out of the configured tolerance, a phase is missing, there is a phase rotation fault or the frequency is out of the configured tolerance.

entry.p: Check the bypass mains at the bypass input terminals.

row.entry: The UPS output is overloaded (>105%).
Reduce the load
The UPS is unable to synchronize to the bypass source.

Check the bypass source quality (voltage, frequency)
The limits of the configured bypass voltage tolerance should be bigger than the limits of the configured output voltage tolerance.
The battery voltage is below the configured low battery voltage warning level.
Charge the battery
The battery switch Q201 / Q202 is open.
The PFC rectifier or the charger is inoperable.
The inverter is inoperable.
The communication to the static bypass switch is not working or DC is detected during requested static bypass operation.

entry.p: Check the wiring to the SBS module.

row.entry: One of the transformer-, SBS- or power module fans is inoperable.
Check the correct functionality of the fans
The UPS measures a temperature above the threshold level in one of the power modules or in one of the power transformers.
Check the air inlet and the air filters
Check the ambient temperature
Check the output load
Digital input
Alarm number
Input text
Alarm text
Description
Corrective action
ECB-EPO
Emergency Power Off
The digital input "emergency power off (EPO)" is activated (contact open) or the EPO wiring is disconnected.

entry.p: If the EPO is activated, normal function. If the EPO is not activated, check the EPO wiring.

row.entry: ECB-In1
Blocking Boost/Initial Charge
Block boost and inital charge

entry.p: The input of the external connection board is configured customer specific. Please see in the setting sheet for details.

row.entry: ECB-In2
Force to Boost Charge
Transfers the UPS into boost charge mode

entry.p: The input of the external connection board is configured customer specific. Please see in the setting sheet for details.

row.entry: Digital output
Alarm number
Output text
Description
Corrective action
ECB-ComAl
There is at least one pending alert in the system.

entry.p: Check the other event.

row.entry: ECB-Out01
The system is in battery operation.
ECB-Out02
The system is in static bypass operation. The bypass supplies the load (temporary or requested static bypass operation).
